intro: Herpestis auriculata, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in dense, bell-shaped inflorescences, giving it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats.
